Name: Abelian group
Definition: a set equipped with a binary operation that satisfies closure, associativity, identity, invertibility and commutativity (or a commutative group)

Name: group
Definition: a set equipped with a binary operation that satisfies closure, associativity, identity and invertibility

Name: magma/groupoid
Definition: a set equipped with a binary operation that satisfies closure

Name: monoid
Definition: a set equipped with a binary operation that satisfies closure, associativity and identity

Name: ring
Definition: a set equipped with two binary operations that generalise the notions of addition and multiplication

Name: semigroup
Definition: a set equipped with a binary operation that satisfies closure and associativity

Name: quasigroup
Definition: a set equipped with a binary operation that obeys the Latin square property

Name: loop
Definition: a set equipped with a binary operation that obeys the Latin square property and has an identity element, or a quasigroup with an identity element

Name: field
Definition: a set equipped with two binary operations, which is an abelian group under the addition (with 0 as additive identity), as well as the nonzero elements being an abelian group under the multiplication (with 1 as multiplicative identity), and the multiplication is distributive over the addition

Name: category
Definition: consists of objects, morphisms, and composition. Associativity and identity hold

Name: real numbers
Definition: the set of all numbers which are, informally, a value of a continuous quantity that can represent a distance along a line

Name: rational numbers
Definition: the set of all numbers which can be expressed as the quotient $\frac{p}{q}$ such that $p$ and $q$ are integers, and $q$ is non-zero.

Name: vector space
Definition: a set that is closed under finite vector addition and scalar multiplication

Name: topological space
Definition: a set of points, along with a set of neighbourhoods for each point, satisfying a set of axioms relating points and neighbourhoods

Name: metric space
Definition: a set for which distances between all members of the set are defined

Name: degenerate interval
Definition: any set consisting of a single real number

Name: open interval
Definition: an interval which does not include its limit points

Name: closed interval
Definition: an interval which includes its limit points

Name: inner product space
Definition: a vector space with an additional structure called an inner product, which associates each pair of vectors in the spaces with a scalar quantity (the inner product)

Name: complete space
Definition: a metric space in which every Cauchy sequence of points in $M$ has a limit in $M$, or converges in $M$. A space is complete if there are no "points missing"

Name: Cauchy sequence
Definition: a sequence whose elements become arbitrarily close to each other as the sequence progresses.

Name: Hilbert space
Definition: a complete space with an inner product

Name: cyclic group
Definition: a group generated by a single element
